intro: Miconia conomicrantha, commonly known as the small-leaved miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree in humid, shaded environments. Miconia conomicrantha is noted for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
